pullrequest.title: Implement the first simple version of soft label

content.raw:
A comment here might be helpful since it's not obvious that find returns -1 on failure. Or perhaps a more pythonic way of doing this for just the condition would be to write something like:
```python
if ":" in datum.name:
```
or in this specific case:
```python
if ":" not in datum.name:
```
But in general it's usually better to state the positive case first.
content.html:
A comment here might be helpful since it's not obvious that find returns -1 on failure. Or perhaps a more pythonic way of doing this for just the condition would be to write something like:

if ":" in datum.name:

or in this specific case:

if ":" not in datum.name:

But in general it's usually better to state the positive case first.

content.raw: I need the variable 'comma_pos' later on, although I don't strictly have to use it but I would rather keep it with a new comment.
content.html: I need the variable 'comma_pos' later on, although I don't strictly have to use it but I would rather keep it with a new comment.

pullrequest.title: Implement the first simple version of soft label

content.raw:
That's true. You may go the comment route. Though it is important to know that you only "need" the comma_pos for the case where you actually find the ":" in the first place. Afterwards you could split at the ":" or just get the `comma_pos` once in you know that it exists.

Also I just realized that the variable should be called `colon_pos` or `colon_positon` at the least. "," is a comma. ":" is a colon.
content.html:
That's true. You may go the comment route. Though it is important to know that you only "need" the comma_pos for the case where you actually find the ":" in the first place. Afterwards you could split at the ":" or just get the comma_pos once in you know that it exists.

Also I just realized that the variable should be called colon_pos or colon_positon at the least. "," is a comma. ":" is a colon.

pullrequest.title: Implement the first simple version of soft label

content.raw:
This one particular line, without inspecting what `modify_supervision_label_extension` does, is not at all obvious to what it's doing. There is a magic number of '1'. There needs to be a comment or a constant representing what the 1 is supposed to represent.

You may also want to consider modifying `modify_supervision_label` so that the default value for the first argument is always 1 so you don't even need to specify here (if it should be the default case).
content.html:
This one particular line, without inspecting what modify_supervision_label_extension does, is not at all obvious to what it's doing. There is a magic number of '1'. There needs to be a comment or a constant representing what the 1 is supposed to represent.

You may also want to consider modifying modify_supervision_label so that the default value for the first argument is always 1 so you don't even need to specify here (if it should be the default case).

pullrequest.title: Implement the first simple version of soft label

content.raw:
Can you explain the reasoning behind this function name and the parameter names? As far as I can tell "new_extension" is simply an integer. The function description also says that it adds the "new_extension" to a set but there is no set (or list) object. `self.supervision_label_extension` is being assigned/set to with a single integer.

What is more confusing is that technically is no modifications are allowed after the parameter has been initially set.
content.html:
Can you explain the reasoning behind this function name and the parameter names? As far as I can tell "new_extension" is simply an integer. The function description also says that it adds the "new_extension" to a set but there is no set (or list) object. self.supervision_label_extension is being assigned/set to with a single integer.

What is more confusing is that technically is no modifications are allowed after the parameter has been initially set.

pullrequest.title: Implement the first simple version of soft label

content.raw:
"Currently supervision_label_extension only support one value, thus an assignment is used to represent add functionality."

In the future, `self.supervision_label_extension` will be changed to a set, thus we can add integer "new_extension" here.
content.html:
"Currently supervision_label_extension only support one value, thus an assignment is used to represent add functionality."

In the future, self.supervision_label_extension will be changed to a set, thus we can add integer "new_extension" here.

pullrequest.title: Implement the first simple version of soft label

content.raw:
GMTK uses the C preprocessor. You should be able to use whatever directives (#if/#ifdef) it does.

The problem is that there is no optimizing compiler, so adding extra operations in here will slow things down. Having it adjusted at the preprocessor stage will ameliorate this.
content.html:
GMTK uses the C preprocessor. You should be able to use whatever directives (#if/#ifdef) it does.

The problem is that there is no optimizing compiler, so adding extra operations in here will slow things down. Having it adjusted at the preprocessor stage will ameliorate this.

content.raw:
The "{" used in if in C, as long as I use it a syntax error will be thrown.

using #endif always told me can't find #if despite #if is used 5 lines above.

Is there a problem of using `a ? b : c` syntax? If its really C preprocessor then it will be translated to if at last.
content.html:
The "{" used in if in C, as long as I use it a syntax error will be thrown.

using #endif always told me can't find #if despite #if is used 5 lines above.

Is there a problem of using a ? b : c syntax? If its really C preprocessor then it will be translated to if at last.

pullrequest.title: Implement the first simple version of soft label

content.raw:
It should be something like

```
#if SUPERVISIONLABEL_EXTENSION == 1
-1 { p1 == (p0-SUPERVISION_LABEL_OFFSET) }
#else
-1 { (p1 > (p0-SUPERVISION_LABEL_OFFSET-1)) && (p1 < (p0-SUPERVISION_LABEL_OFFSET+SUPERVISIONLABEL_EXTENSION)) }
#endif
```

The ternary operator syntax (for example, `a ? b : c`) will be interpreted by GMTK once per frame. Much slower than putting things in the preprocessor when possible.
```
content.html:
It should be something like

#if SUPERVISIONLABEL_EXTENSION == 1
-1 { p1 == (p0-SUPERVISION_LABEL_OFFSET) }
#else
-1 { (p1 > (p0-SUPERVISION_LABEL_OFFSET-1)) && (p1 < (p0-SUPERVISION_LABEL_OFFSET+SUPERVISIONLABEL_EXTENSION)) }
#endif

The ternary operator syntax (for example, a ? b : c) will be interpreted by GMTK once per frame. Much slower than putting things in the preprocessor when possible. ```
